name: p-dinitrobenzene
source: Aldrich Chemical Company; Aldrich Catalog-Handbook of Fine Chemicals; Milwaukee; WI; 1984.
Reason: 1,2,3-Trinitro compounds have a melting point influenced by the functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The presence of three nitro groups significantly increases the melting point due to strong electronegativity which leads to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each nitro group is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately +50°C.
